oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Improving rice yield and quality through inoculation with mycorrhiza and plant growth promoting rhizobacteria in India
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Srivastava, R.
Berset, E.
Mäder, P.
Fried, P.M.
Sharma, A.K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil
India
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Microorganisms were integrated as bio-fertilizers in a wheat-rice trial in India. Four-year results show that Rice grain yield was 30% higher, compared to control plots, after application of an inoculum containing mycorrhiza and rhizo-bacteria. Substantial increase of grain Quality was achieved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Srivastava, R.; Berset, E.; Mäder, P.; Fried, P.M. and Sharma, A.K. (2012) Improving rice yield and quality through inoculation with mycorrhiza and plant growth promoting rhizobacteria in India. Paper at: Roots to the futuere - 8th Symposium of the International Society of Root Research (ISRR), Dalhousie Building, University of Dundee, 26-29 June 2012.
